item.title: DREADMOOR to be published by Digital Vortex
item.content:encoded:
Digital Vortex will publish Dream Dock-developed horror fishing game DREADMOOR when it launches for PC via Steam in Q4 2026, the companies announced.

“We’re building an [intellectual property] that goes far beyond fishing in the apocalypse,” said Dream Dock CEO Rostislav Fedorov in a press release. “Partnering with Digital Vortex Entertainment allows us to scale production, refine the vision, and bring DREADMOOR‘s madness to a global audience.”

Digital Vortex CEO Alex Izotov added, “At Digital Vortex Entertainment, we were captivated by Dream Dock’s clear vision for the game and their approach to creating a haunting fusion inspired by Lovecraftian horror and post-nuclear survival. It’s a unique and powerful project, and we’re excited to help bring their dark and beautiful world to a wide audience.”

Here is a brief overview of the game, via Digital Vortex Entertainment:

DREADMOOR quickly made a splash among fans of dark, atmospheric adventures: just 10 days after its announcement in April 2025, the game amassed over 40,000 wishlists, and already ranks in the top 600 most-wishlisted games on Steam with minimal marketing thus far. This strong interest has set a positive trajectory for the title, with a clear roadmap aiming for its full release in Q4 2026.

DREADMOOR is a dark first-person horror fishing adventure game. Anglers explore both land and sea, fishing for a wide variety of aquatic creatures lurking in the depths, and fighting their way through a flooded wasteland filled with danger and mystery. The game draws inspiration from titles like DREDGE, Metro Exodus, and Resident Evil. It features cinematic storytelling, psychological tension, crafting, and addictive fishing mechanics.

Watch a new trailer below.

Publisher Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/10/dreadmoor-to-be-published-by-digital-vortex

item.title: The Witch’s Bakery adds PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch versions
item.content:encoded:
Cozy side-scrolling adventure RPG The Witch’s Bakery will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch alongside its previously announced PC (Steam) version in 2026, publisher Silver Lining Interactive and developer Sunny Lab announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Silver Lining Interactive:

About

The Witch’s Bakery is a 2D adventure RPG about a joyful witch who opens her bakery in modern Paris. She has one special power: she can see into people’s heart and heal emotions through magic!

Your Daily Life as a Witch-Baker in Paris

You play as Lunne, who has just arrived in the city! Each day is split into three phases:

  • Daytime – When Lunne manages her bakery and serves clients with her team of friends.
  • Evening – When Lunne explores Paris, builds relationships, discovers the city’s secrets and goes inside her friends’ troubled heart.
  • Night – When Lunne rests, improves her magic, decorates her bakery and spends time in her cosy atelier.

The story progresses through the days as you earn experience, money, and fame, meet new friends and heal their heart.

A Colorful Paris in a Joyful Adventure

Once your work day is done, you can visit several districts of Paris to meet with main characters, engage in activities to learn new skills, buy books for new recipes, etc.

One example is “Le Quai des Bouquinistes” located in the sixth arrondissement of Paris! This place is known for its book sellers and its collectors of various entertainment goods, like vinyls, posters, old magazines… But also, of course, for the beautiful Notre-Dame.

Each district has its own characters, activities and shops!

A Story About Emotions and Vulnerability

For some people, their emotion is locked away so strongly than Lunne needs to go inside their heart to help them. She enters their “Heart Palace,” a magical space where emotions and thoughts take shape. Lunne needs to guide the personified Emotion back to the heart.

Inside the Heart Palace, Lunne discovers the person’s deepest struggles and finds the key ingredient she needs to make a bread that will heal them!

Watch a new trailer below.

PlayStation 5 Announce Trailer

Xbox Series Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/10/the-witchs-bakery-adds-ps5-xbox-series-and-switch-versions
